en.title: Hi üëã, I'm
en.name: Miqueias Belfort
en.subtitle: "Talk is cheap, show me the code" - Linus Torvalds
en.aboutme: Hello, my name is Miqueias, I live in Bras√≠lia-DF, I study Software Engineering, and I have been developing for more or less 2 years, mainly with Javascript, Node, React, etc... Today I work as a freelancer, in addition to interning in the development area, always staying focused and determined to change the world.

skills.title: Skills
skills.default: Hello, here you can see all my skills and what they can do...
skills.html: HTML is a markup language used to build web pages. HTML documents can be interpreted by browsers.
skills.css: CSS is called Cascading Style Sheet language and is used to style elements written in a markup language like HTML. CSS separates the content from the visual representation of the website.
skills.js: JavaScript is a structured, high-level scripting, weakly dynamically typed, multi-paradigm interpreted programming language.
skills.ts: TypeScript is an open source programming language developed by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language.
skills.react: React is an open-source JavaScript front-end library focused on creating user interfaces on web pages.
skills.node: Node.js is open source, cross-platform software, based on Google's V8 interpreter and which allows JavaScript code to be executed outside of a web browser.
skills.csharp: C# is a strongly typed, multi-paradigm programming language developed by Microsoft as part of the .NET platform. Its object-oriented syntax was based on C++ but includes many influences from other programming languages, such as Object Pascal and, mainly, Java.
skills.firebase: Firebase Realtime Database is a cloud-hosted NoSQL database. With it, you store and synchronize data between your users in real time. Cloud Firestore lets you store, sync, and query app data on a global scale.
skills.sql: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a standard language for creating and manipulating databases.
skills.git: GitHub is a collaborative development platform that hosts projects in the cloud using the version control system called Git. The platform helps developers store and manage code and records changes.
skills.java: Java is a programming language and computing platform first released by Sun Microsystems in 1995. From humble beginnings, it has evolved into a major player in today's digital world, providing the reliable platform on which many services and applications are developed.

pro1.title: SuperChat
pro1.desc: A real-time online chat using webSocket technology with Node and React.

pro2.title: Netflix Clone
pro2.desc: A Netflix clone made with React, using TMDB (The Movie Database) API.

pro3.title: API com GO
pro3.desc: An API using the GO Programming language, which can add, read, edit and delete data from a SQL Database.
